function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased production of 3D-printed PPE leading to potential quality control issues and defective equipment","Impact":"Inadequate PPE may result in increased risk of virus transmission and inadequate protection for healthcare workers and the general public","Mitigation":"Implement strict quality control measures and testing at every stage of the production process","Technologies":"Quality control sensors and testing equipment for 3D printing processes","People":"Healthcare workers, general public","Owner":"3D printing companies, regulatory authorities"},{"Description":"Global reliance on 3D-printed PPE leading to supply chain vulnerabilities and disruptions","Impact":"Supply chain disruptions may lead to shortages of PPE in critical areas, putting healthcare workers and the public at greater risk of exposure","Mitigation":"Diversify PPE production sources and establish backup supply chains","Technologies":"Supply chain management software and predictive analytics for demand forecasting","People":"Healthcare workers, general public, PPE manufacturers","Owner":"Government authorities, PPE manufacturers"},{"Description":"Rapid production of 3D-printed PPE without adequate sterilization processes","Impact":"Risk of contamination and spread of infectious diseases due to improperly sterilized PPE","Mitigation":"Establish standardized sterilization protocols and guidelines for 3D-printed PPE","Technologies":"Sterilization equipment and UV-C sterilization technology","People":"Healthcare workers, general public","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, PPE manufacturers"}]}
